intro: Mussaenda elmeri, commonly known as the golden glorybower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, characterized by its dense, hairy foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that are highly attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape and have a rough texture. Mussaenda elmeri thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sun.
